intro: Fissistigma rufinerve, commonly known as the red-veined fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Blechnaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, finely divided fronds that are often adorned with prominent red veins. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or rocky crevices. Its rhizomes are creeping and produce clusters of small, spore-bearing leaves. The unique coloration of its veins makes it a distinctive and ornamental plant in horticulture.
